intro: Lesquerella diversifolia, commonly known as the yellow lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lesquerella diversifolia is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species for studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
